name: ANNNA

coffee.style: Specialty espresso, filter, cold brew, decaf

description: Gluten-free artisan sourdough bakery and specialty coffee concept store in a 19th-century townhouse (Casa Trachsler). Run by Ana (bakery) and Pascal (coffee). The first specialty coffee in the Sant Feliu area. Also a curated store with local olive products, natural wines, and Sant Feliu merch. Dog-friendly, wheelchair accessible, outdoor seating.

name: La Maglia Coffee & Co

coffee.roaster: La Maglia (own roastery, first on Costa Brava coast)
coffee.style: Specialty espresso, 100% Arabica ≥85 SCA points. Origins include Brazil, Ethiopia, Honduras, Guatemala.

hours: From 08:00 until mid-afternoon. Contact for exact hours.
description: The first specialty coffee roaster on the Costa Brava coast, opened during the pandemic. Bike-friendly café with healthy food, açaí bowls, sourdough toasts from La Farinera (Sant Feliu). Own roastery next door roasting 3x/week. Expanding to a 300m² warehouse/café in Calonge (2027). Collaborates with km0 producers (La Puntual bakery, Can Pericus charcutería). Revenue >1M€.

name: Fitzroy Café

coffee.style: Specialty espresso, filter (summer only), flat white, matcha

hours: Mon, Wed–Sun 09:00–14:00 (may add 19:00–22:00 evenings). Closed Tue. Hours may vary seasonally.
description: Melbourne-inspired specialty coffee and brunch café in Begur's old town, near Plaça de la Iglesia. Menu includes kimcheese toasties, smash avo toast, banana pancakes, sourdough bagels. Vegan and GF options. Natural wines and craft beer. Named after the hip Melbourne neighborhood. Seasonal operation — check before visiting in winter.

name: Grava

coffee.roaster: Right Side Coffee (unconfirmed, reported by locals)
coffee.style: Specialty espresso

description: Trendy specialty café, pizzeria, and restaurant at the foot of Pals medieval village. Outdoor chill-out yard popular with gravel cyclists. Serves homemade pizzas, burgers, tapas, craft beers, and natural wines alongside specialty coffee. Hosts sunset gravel bike rides and yoga events. Self-described as 'la mejor cafetería de especialidad y pizzería en la Costa Brava'.

name: Rustik Empordà

coffee.style: Espresso-based, described as 'exquisite coffee'

description: Bike-friendly café and bakery in Bellcaire d'Empordà village, open since June 2018. Known for incredible toasts, filled croissants (try chocolate & banana), sandwiches, and fresh fruit yogurt bowls. The 'Rustik Lab' keeps innovating. Popular cycling pit-stop. Pet-friendly. Off-menu requests welcome.

name: Casa Nereta — Café Nereta

coffee.style: Full 360° coffee experience: espresso (La Marzocco + Mahlkönig), V60 pour-over, batch brew, steeped bags

description: Japanese-inspired coffee shop inside Casa Nereta boutique hotel in Cadaqués. Since 2025 serves a 360° La Cabra Coffee experience — Denmark's renowned specialty roaster known for traceability and precision. La Marzocco machine, Mahlkönig grinder. Pastries by El Puto Ken, premium Kettl matcha from Japan. Smooth soulful music. Also a design-forward hotel with wellness (yoga, massage) and DJ sessions. One of the finest specialty coffee experiences on the entire Costa Brava.

name: Dupla
address: Sant Antoni de Calonge (exact address unconfirmed)

coffee.roaster: Unknown (reported specialty, possibly Right Side or Nomad)
coffee.style: Specialty espresso, pour-over, batch brew

hours: Unknown — check Instagram for seasonal hours
description: New specialty coffee and brunch spot in Sant Antoni de Calonge. Near the beachfront. Still relatively new and building a following. Details are sparse — recommended to verify in person or via Instagram. Part of the growing specialty coffee scene between Platja d'Aro and Palamós.

name: Zero

coffee.style: Specialty espresso, filter, cold brew/drip, decaf

description: Specialty coffee café in Palamós serving espresso, filter, cold brew, and decaf. Breakfast and lunch with vegan options. Plant-based milks available. Free Wi-Fi, laptop-friendly, dog-friendly, outdoor seating. 5.0/5 on TripAdvisor. A quiet, quality-focused spot away from the tourist strip.

name: Maison Marcel

coffee.roaster: Unknown (quality coffee, not confirmed specialty roaster)
coffee.style: Freshly made coffee alongside French artisan pastries

description: French artisan bakery and café in Sant Feliu de Guíxols run by Andrea and Franck. Famous for butter croissants with organic km0 flour, pain au chocolat, Paris-Brest, and tiramisú. Called 'Best Coffee Shop in Spain' by some TripAdvisor reviewers (5.0/5, 34 reviews). Not confirmed as specialty coffee roaster, but the coffee quality is praised. A must-visit for pastry lovers.

name: La Maglia Coffee & Co (Girona)
address: Girona city center (Velódromo, antiguo teatro Odeon)

coffee.style: Specialty espresso, same beans as Platja d'Aro location

hours: Open Sundays. Contact for exact hours.
description: La Maglia's second location in Girona's old town, opened 2023 in partnership with Velódromo in the historic Odeon theater. Same own-roasted specialty coffee. Local bakery collaborations. Part of the growing La Maglia empire that's putting Costa Brava specialty coffee on the map.

name: La Fábrica

coffee.roaster: Approachable Coffee (own roaster, by Christian Meier)
coffee.style: Specialty espresso (Rocket R8 two-group), single roast designed for black or with dairy

hours: Every day 08:00–17:30. Closed Dec 25 & Jan 6 only.
description: The OG specialty coffee café of Girona, opened March 2015 by former professional cyclist Christian Meier and his wife Amber. Housed in a converted carpenter's workshop with stone walls. Tire pump at the door, borrowable cable locks. 90+ pro cyclists frequent it. Amber bakes pastries from her own oven. Roasts under the Approachable Coffee label on a 15-kilo Joper roaster. Green beans sourced from Falcon Coffees and Mare Terra. Wholesale now reaches Barcelona, Jakarta, Portland, and Vienna.

name: Espresso Mafia

coffee.style: Up to 5 different coffees including tasting flights, nitro coffee, seasonal offerings. Custom Sanremo Cafe Racer two-group.

description: La Fábrica's experimental sibling, opened March 2017. More modern décor, smaller space, no Wi-Fi. Serves up to five different Approachable Coffee roasts with tasting flights and seasonal specials like nitro coffee. Custom two-group Sanremo Cafe Racer machine. Cheesecake and other desserts. Two-minute walk from La Fábrica.

name: Oniria Café

coffee.style: Third-wave specialty, espresso, filter. Sells beans for home.

description: Small specialty café opened 2021 by a passionate couple. Focuses on third-wave coffee with rotating guest roasters from across Europe. Raw vegan and sugar-free pastries, artisan baked goods. Sells specialty beans for home brewing. Cozy, conscious, and intimate. Dog-friendly, outdoor seating.

name: Originem

coffee.style: Specialty espresso, filter, cold brew, decaf. Plant-based milks.

description: Sustainable km0 café in Girona's old town. Works with local producers for zero-waste offerings. Coffee served in handmade ceramic cups. Organic sweets, sourdough toast, and Catalan pastries like xuixo. Modern white interiors with original stone walls and wood beams. Also a small market selling regional products. Laptop-friendly, dog-friendly.

name: Federal Café

coffee.style: Specialty espresso and brunch focus

description: Part of the Federal Café chain (Madrid, Barcelona, Valencia, Girona). Contemporary, minimalist brunch restaurant with specialty coffee. Near Girona Cathedral in the old city. Avocado toast, eggs benedict, pancakes, Nasi Goreng. Cyclist-friendly, sustainable, vegetarian/vegan/GF options. 4.3/5 on TripAdvisor (400+ reviews).

name: Hors Catégorie

coffee.style: Specialty espresso (Rocket Espresso machine)

description: Cyclist-themed Bike Healthy Cafe in Girona. Named after the toughest cycling climb category. Serves Nomad Coffee specialty on a Rocket Espresso machine. Healthy food, craft beer, cycling memorabilia. Also serves evening drinks. Popular with the pro cycling community based in Girona. Sells specialty beans.

name: SHOTS Coffee & Brunch
address: Carrer del Bisbe Tomàs de Lorenzana, 47

coffee.style: Specialty coffee, matcha

description: Brunch-focused café in Girona with km0 quality ingredients. Açaí bowls, sweet and savory toasts, vegan sandwiches. Gluten-free, vegan, and vegetarian options. Plant-based milks. Plugs near tables for laptop workers. Good coffee and matcha.

name: It's Coffee Time

coffee.style: Espresso-based, matcha latte, skilled baristas

description: Beachfront café in L'Escala serving 100% Arabica coffee with sea views. Pancakes, smoothies, bagels, açaí bowls. Healthy and fresh focus. Called 'the best coffee in Spain' by some reviewers. 4.8/5 on TripAdvisor with Travelers' Choice recognition. Not confirmed as specialty-roaster level but high-quality execution.

name: Satan's Coffee Corner

coffee.style: Specialty espresso (Slayer machine), filtered coffee, cold brew

description: Outpost of Barcelona's legendary Satan's Coffee Corner. Uses Right Side Coffee Roasters beans brewed dark and punchy on Slayer machines. The only inland Girona province location for this pioneering specialty chain. Santa Coloma de Farners is inland (not coastal Costa Brava), but within the province.

name: Mozaik Coffee Bakery

coffee.style: Coffee with smoothies and fresh juices

description: Coffee bakery in Lloret de Mar. Smoothies, fresh fruit juices, and coffee. Limited details available — specialty status unconfirmed. One of the few quality-focused coffee spots in the southern Costa Brava tourist zone. (Unverified — may be new, Franc doesn't know it)

name: Grace Coffee

coffee.style: Espresso, decaf, plant-based milks

description: Casual café in Platja d'Aro. Breakfast, lunch, espresso-based drinks. Laptop-friendly, kids-friendly, dog-friendly, outdoor seating. Mixed reviews on TripAdvisor. Not confirmed as specialty, but offers a step above standard tourist coffee. Convenient location.

name: Re Mei

coffee.style: Specialty coffee with La Marzocco

description: Modern Mediterranean restaurant in Cadaqués with a serious coffee program — Nomad Coffee on a La Marzocco. One of the rare restaurants on the Costa Brava that treats coffee as seriously as food.
